summary: This is an internal email from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, forwarding a Daily Beast article about a public dispute between Prince Andrew and U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman regarding Andrew's alleged non-cooperation with the FBI's Epstein investigation. The email captures the conflicting public statements and includes legal analysis from a former prosecutor.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York is accused by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman of giving "zero co-operation" to the Epstein investigation, while Andrew's camp claims he is willing to talk but has not been approached by the FBI.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The prosecutor publicly called out Prince Andrew for non-cooperation at a press conference outside Epstein's home, stating his office had made several attempts to contact Andrew's representatives.

persons.name: Duncan Levin
persons.role: Former federal and New York state prosecutor, managing partner at Tucker Levin, PLLC
persons.context: Provided legal analysis to The Daily Beast, commenting on the unusual nature of a prosecutor publicly criticizing a witness's reluctance to cooperate and the uniqueness of the Epstein case.

events.title: Berman's Press Conference Accusing Prince Andrew
events.description: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman held a press conference outside Jeffrey Epstein's home, publicly stating Prince Andrew had given "zero co-operation" to the investigation and that his office had made several attempts to contact Andrew's representatives.

events.title: Prince Andrew's Newsnight Interview
events.description: Prince Andrew gave a televised interview where he stated he was "willing to help any appropriate law-enforcement agency with their investigations, if required." Berman referenced this pledge in his criticism.

events.title: Public War of Words
events.description: Following Berman's comments, a public dispute erupted with Prince Andrew's camp denying any request for cooperation had been received and claiming he was "angry and bewildered" by the allegations.

locations: Epstein's infamous front door (likely referring to his New York mansion)
keyFacts: U.S. Attorney Geoffrey Berman publicly accused Prince Andrew of providing "zero co-operation" to the FBI's investigation into Jeffrey Epstein.
Prince Andrew's representatives denied the claim, stating he was "more than happy to talk to the FBI" but had not been approached, and that he was "angry and bewildered" by Berman's allegations.
Berman stated his office had "made several attempts to contact" Andrew's representatives, directly contradicting the Prince's claims.

Legal analyst Duncan Levin noted it was "highly unusual for a prosecutor to make a public statement about a witness's reluctance to cooperate," highlighting the extraordinary nature of the Epstein case.
Berman justified his public call-out by referencing Prince Andrew's own pledge to help law enforcement made during his November 2019 BBC Newsnight interview.
